CPRS is CCOW Compliant!
CPRS is CCOW Compliant!

• CCOW: Clinical Context Object Workgroup
• CCOW: Clinical Context Object Workgroup

– HL7 standard protocol – Enables different applications to synchronize in real-
– HL7 standard protocol
– Enables different applications to synchronize in real-

time (share the same patient!)
time (share the same patient!)

– Applications operate in a unified, cohesive way
– Applications operate in a unified, cohesive way

• Different applications ‘share’ the same patient
• Different applications ‘share’ the same patient

– Known as “Patient Context”
– Known as “Patient Context”

• Can also provide single sign-on between applications
• Can also provide single sign-on between applications

– Known as “User Context”
– Known as “User Context”

Why is CCOW important to You?
Why is CCOW important to
You?

• Don’t have to select the patient again when using
• Don’t have to select the patient again when using

different clinical applications in a session
different clinical applications in a session

• But…. Be careful
• But…. Be careful

– must be aware when CPRS is and is not participating
– must be aware when CPRS is and is not participating

– Careful with multiple CPRS Chart sessions open at
– Careful with multiple CPRS Chart sessions open at

in Patient Context
in Patient Context

the same time!
the same time!

CPRS and Patient Context • You know CPRS is in patient context when you see the “little blue person with a chain link” icon
CPRS and Patient Context
• You know CPRS is in patient context when
you see the “little blue person with a chain
link” icon

• CPRS is not in patient context when you see the “crowd of people with a broken link” icon
• CPRS is not in patient context when you see
the “crowd of people with a broken link” icon

CCOW: Take Home Message #1
CCOW: Take Home Message #1

• Be aware when CPRS is not in patient
• Be aware when CPRS is not in patient

context – Broken link crowded people icon – Applications can NOT share this patient
context
– Broken link crowded people icon
– Applications can NOT share this patient

• You can “Set New Context” via CPRS File
• You can “Set New Context” via CPRS File

CCOW: Take Home Message #2 No CCOW icon is not a good thing!
CCOW: Take Home Message #2
No CCOW icon is not a good thing!

Cause: Starting CPRS too quickly after logging onto the Computer
Cause: Starting CPRS too
quickly after logging onto
the Computer

Solution: Exit CPRS and start it again.
Solution:
Exit CPRS and start it
again. a g a i n .
